Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[monodroid] Use aotprofile extension for default AOT profile" (#2887) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Also fix the other profilers extension setting, where we were 1
character short when parameters were specified.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests] Add framework for Commercial Builds" (#2892) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We want to move all of our unit tests into one place.
This means that tests now need to know if they are
running against a Open Source build or a Commercial
build.

We detect that by looking for the
`Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets` in the
Android MSBuild directory.

We also change over the TestCaseSource in the
`BuildTest.OSS.cs` to be methods rather than
properties. This is so we can (in the future)
dynamically update the items to test both the
Open Source and Commercial build behavour.
There are differences between the two builds
(like fastdev) so the test cases are not always
the same.

We also updated ALL the `TestCaseSource` attributes
to name use of `nameof` rather than strings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Add TestsFlavor parameter to RenameTestCases task" (#2894) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
After adding more logging in
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/a6eb47aea, it turned
out that the path to the logcat file is wrong. Note the directory of
the logcat in the following log message:

    Could not find file `/Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-android-pr-pipeline-release/xamarin-android/build-tools/scripts/../../bin/TestRelease-Profiled-Aot/logcat-Release-Profiled-Aot-Mono.Android_Tests.txt`.  Will not be including `adb logcat` output.

The `bin/TestRelease-Profiled-Aot/` part should be `bin/TestRelease/`
instead.

This patch changes it so, that we pass `Configuration` and
`TestsFlavor` separately to the task and the logcat path should now be
correct.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AndroidX Skip Items Support" (#2895) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
For AndroidX support we need to be able to skip over processing of some of the older support libraries if they are referenced. For example we should NOT extract any resources, or generate any java code for those libraries. 

So this to work we need to be able to define which assemblies to skip processing on. Commits 02c07ed6 and 5f27d0ca put in the framework to allow us to skip items based on metadata.
We already have `SkipAndroidResourceProcessing` in place and need to add the following extra items.

- SkipJavaStubsGeneration
- SkipResourceExtraction
- SkipPackaging

These new items will allow us to skip over processing of certain assemblies when they are not needed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Fix a typo which supressed the AOT test runs" (#2890) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/e22345162a25a7aa9d1ca35c590253d5462e9660
made the AOT tests conditional. Unfortunately it contained a typo in
the path, which prevented the AOT runs, because the condition was
always resolved as False.

Events.RelatedBody: That would need changes to mono runtime's AOT profiler to have the profile written before the application shutdown.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "JNI thread management issue" (#2893) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I am using `libvlc` in a Xamarin.Android application and get a reproducible native crash. 

I'm not 100% sure, but it looks like mono makes assumptions regarding JNI interactions in this code:
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/c474d4c82330c4b13ecc21a9e16a9d66b329611c/src/monodroid/jni/monodroid-glue.cc#L339-L369

VLC has similar code:
```
         /* if GetEnv returns JNI_OK, the thread is already attached to the
         * JavaVM, so we are already in a java thread, and we don't have to
         * setup any destroy callbacks */
        if ((*jvm)->GetEnv(jvm, (void **)&env, JNI_VERSION_1_2) != JNI_OK)
        {
            /* attach the thread to the Java VM */
            JavaVMAttachArgs args;

            args.version = JNI_VERSION_1_2;
            args.name = psz_name;
            args.group = NULL;

            if ((*jvm)->AttachCurrentThread(jvm, &env, &args) != JNI_OK)
                return NULL;

            /* Set the attached env to the thread-specific data area (TSD) */
            if (pthread_setspecific(jni_env_key, env) != 0)
            {
                (*jvm)->DetachCurrentThread(jvm);
                return NULL;
            }
}
```
https://github.com/videolan/vlc-3.0/blob/264d5a9ec1bc1b2e4d9defa6be49cf7ef39a2984/modules/video_output/android/utils.c#L374-L395

### Steps to Reproduce

1. https://code.videolan.org/videolan/LibVLCSharp/issues/123
2. Run the vout sample from https://github.com/kakone/libvlcsharp_samples/tree/master/Samples/Samples

### Expected Behavior

No crash.

### Actual Behavior

Crash because mono calls `DetachCurrentThread` on a thread it doesn't own.

### Version Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.9.9
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.9.9+28307.518
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Installed Version: Community

Visual C++ 2017   00369-60000-00001-AA760

We also change over the TestCaseSource in the

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Forms NetworkChange Events Don't Fire in iOS" (#5348) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

When using the NetworkChange class and connecting to the NetworkAddressChanged and NetworkAvailabilityChanged events, the events only fire immediately after they are connected. 

Then if you disconnect Wifi or do something that should cause them to fire again, they never fire. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.net.networkinformation.networkchange?view=netframework-4.7.2

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Connect to NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged and NetworkChange.NetworkAvailabilityChanged events to event handlers
2. Disconnect iOS wifi or change to another accesspoint
3. Events never fire to tell you the address changed or the availability changed

### Expected Behavior

In Windows UWP and Android, the events fire whenever the wifi connection changes to indicate the wiifi disconnected so the ip changes to 0.0.0.0 and then it fires again when the wifi reconnects and notifies you that the network address has changed to a new ip. 

### Actual Behavior

When using the NetworkChange class in Xamarin Forms on iOS, the events fire once after they are connected to event handlers. Then they never fire again no matter what changes with the iOS wifi or network settings. 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.169047
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS 2017 15.9.1
- Platform Target Frameworks: iOS <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS: 12.1 <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: iPad and iPhone

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

// Subscribe to NetworkChange events
NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged += new NetworkAddressChangedEventHandler(m_OnNetwork_AddressChanged);
NetworkChange.NetworkAvailabilityChanged += m_OnNetwork_NetworkAvailabilityChanged;

private void m_OnNetwork_AddressChanged(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
	// Only fires once on iOS regardless of network change activity	
}			

private void m_OnNetwork_NetworkAvailabilityChanged(object sender, NetworkAvailabilityEventArgs _Event)
{
	// Only fires once on iOS regardless of network change activity
}

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "- Extend Control Gallery to allow for Shell UI Tests" (#5740) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

- added UI test for Issue4684 to demonstrate UI tests
- Added an internal constructor to shell that lets us disable the flag check. Since all our UI tests have internals visible this makes it easy to circumvent the flag check without changing the flags
- added a TestShell base class to mimic other Test<Pages>. Added some helper methods here for opening flyout and clicking on menus
- Added Store shell to top list of gallery so it can be swapped in for main page
- Changed the base class on store shell to test shell. In theory this should make it so you can create an Issue that just inherits from StoreShell and then write a UI test against StoreShell
- Changed the AccessibilityIdentifier on the app bar button on iOS to be OK like it is on android which is probably wrong in both cases but now it's at least consistently wrong. This will need to be updated to a more correct AccessibilityIdentifier
- 


### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - internal Shell(bool checkFlags)

### Platforms Affected ### 
- iOS
- Android

### Testing Procedure ###
- run store shell from gallery home page
- click into Issue4684 and see that it opens to shell

### PR Checklist ###

- [X] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Jenkins] When running tests on VSTS do specify a device type." (#5817) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
We are going to split the work between different types of devices:

- iOS
- iOS Beta
- AppleTv
- AppleTv Beta

So the idea is that before we have the beta devices and the split execution, we should be able to pass the device type so that when the person doing the monitoring can state which of the devices failed.

We add a default value so that the device test works.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Issue with MacOS 10.14.4" (#5816) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Upgrade your Mac to MacOS 10.14.4, Upgrade Xcode to 10.2, Upgrade Visual Studio to 15.9.10 (Xamarin.iOS to 12.2.1.16)
2. Open in Visual Studio a Xamarin Forms solution with a iOS project, connect Visual Studio to your Mac
3. Compile

### Expected Behavior
The application compiles

### Actual Behavior
The application do not compile, and returns the error:
**This copy of libswiftCore.dylib requires an OS version prior to 10.14.4.**
Attached the full build log.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Could not compile file(s) '/../Xamarin.iOS.dll.s'" (#5815) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Pair Visual Studio with the mac
2. Connect iPhone that is already included in devices that are registered in the used Provisionig Profile
3. Select Debug option and the iPhone already plugged in the mac

### Expected Behavior
Deploy application on the device
### Actual Behavior
There is Compilation error when I start deploying.
I've cleaned the solution, deleted both 'bin' and 'obj' folders, along with the '/Users/MyUser/Library/Caches/Xamarin' whole folder on the mac.
And there is still below compilation error occured: Could not compile the file(s) '/Users/MyUser/Library/Caches/Xamarin/mtbs/builds/MyProject.iOS/88a37a8ff8359042479f20abe19eb7ae/obj/iPhone/Debug/mtouch-cache/armv7/Xamarin.iOS.dll.s'. Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com
There is no problem with debugging on ios simulators.
### Environment

### Steps to Reproduce
Configure the solution to run UserDetailsClient.iOS project, While building the project, error is thrown

### Expected Behavior
Project should build successfully
### Actual Behavior
Project does not build successfully and throws an error mentioned below
**_Severity	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	Can't resolve the reference 'System.String System.String::TrimStart(System.Char)', referenced from the method 'Microsoft.Identity.Json.Schema.JsonSchema Microsoft.Identity.Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder::ResolveReferences(Microsoft.Identity.Json.Schema.JsonSchema)' in 'mscorlib, Version=2.0.5.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=7cec85d7bea7798e'.	UserDetailsClient.iOS_**			

### Environment

Visual studio professional 2017 version 15.8.6

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dynamic is not building on iOS using --interp" (#5673) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Xamarin.iOS custom build 
```
Xamarin.iOS
Version: 12.7.1.69 (Visual Studio Enterprise)
Hash: 011f73e9
Branch: xi-interpreter
```

Using `dynamic` is causing an build error:

```csharp
dynamic creator = methodCreator.Invoke (null, BindingFlags.Public | BindingFlags.Static, null, new object[] { dfsValue, null }, null);
object maze = creator.Create (rows, columns);
```

Error: **` ViewController.cs(85,18,85,25): error CS0656: Missing compiler required member 'Microsoft.CSharp.RuntimeBinder.CSharpArgumentInfo.Create'`**

Source: https://github.com/viniciusjarina/MazeInterpreter/blob/master/test_interpreter/ViewController.cs#L85
